snippet: As the search engine restores links that it had removed to comply with a court order, its handling of the “right to be forgotten” becomes murkier.
abstract: Google restores search-engine links to several newspaper articles from The Guardian, which it had removed in trying to comply with European court order that ordered it to honor requests from individuals to remove information from the Internet; Google declines to explain decision and critics say episode highlights lack of transparency about how company is complying with court order.
lead_paragraph: As the search engine restores links that it had removed to comply with a court order, its handling of the “right to be forgotten” becomes murkier.

headline.main: Google Reinstates European Links to Articles From The Guardian
headline.print_headline: Adapting to Privacy Ruling, Google Chooses to Hit ‘Undo’
